places_to_visit.name: South Rim
places_to_visit.description: The South Rim offers the most accessible views of the Grand Canyon, with various viewpoints, including Mather Point and Yavapai Observation Station, showcasing breathtaking vistas.

places_to_visit.name: North Rim
places_to_visit.description: The North Rim provides a more secluded experience with stunning views, including Bright Angel Point. Itâ€™s less crowded compared to the South Rim.

places_to_visit.name: Havasu Falls
places_to_visit.description: Havasu Falls is a stunning waterfall located in the Havasupai Indian Reservation. Known for its striking blue-green waters, it requires a hike to reach.

places_to_visit.name: Grand Canyon Skywalk
places_to_visit.description: The Grand Canyon Skywalk is a glass bridge extending over the canyon, offering a unique and thrilling view of the canyon floor 4,000 feet below.

places_to_visit.name: Desert View Watchtower
places_to_visit.description: Desert View Watchtower provides panoramic views of the Grand Canyon and the Colorado River. Its design is inspired by ancient Puebloan structures.
